destinations.name: The Arts Center
destinations.description: The Arts Center hosts a reception for IMAGINE.  The exhibit shows prints by Wes Cropper, Jim Hockenhull and Loraine Richey. All use digital tools to come to their end result, with Cropper working purely digital, Richey much more photo based and Hockenhull as a hybrid between the two approaches.

destinations.name: ArtWorks (CEI) Gallery
destinations.description:
Larry Hurst                                                                                                                                                                   What He Sees                                                                                                                                                                   
Works by Eugene artist Larry Hurst at ArtWorks (CEI)                                                                                    Opening Reception: Thursday July 21, 4-8pm (part of CAW)                                                                                       408 SW Monroe Ave/161 Corvallis, OR                                                                                                                  Info: Bruce@ceiworks.org                                                                                                                                                                                                               outpost1000.weebly.com/larry-hurst.html                                                                                   artsandcultureeugene.org
Thanks to OSLP Arts & Culture for photo and support                                                                                                   and to guest curator Kris Askew

destinations.name: Azure Fine Art Gallery
destinations.description: Art and artists from the Window on Art project.  Ranging from exploratory to practiced and performance to photo this exhibit spans the entirety.  Artists include Christopher Adams, Tanner Henderson, Francisco Morales, Madelaine Corbin, Lauren Ohlgren, Katrina Henry and Lauren Sharpton.

destinations.name: Brittney West Studio
destinations.description: What happens when you mix absurdity, activism and artwork? Come see Britt's new paintings for yourselves! Spoiler: There will be googly eyes.

destinations.name: Fairbanks Art Gallery
destinations.description:
Oregon State University’s Fairbanks Gallery is hosting a summer-long art faculty exhibit at Fairbanks Gallery from June 14 through September 28.

The exhibit will be in Fairbanks Hall, 220 S.W. 26th St., on the OSU campus. It will include work by Evan Baden, Michael Boonstra, Julia Bradshaw, Kay Campbell, Anna Fidler, Julie Green, Stephen Hayes, Yuji Hiratsuka, Shelley Jordon, Andy Myers, Kerry Skarbakka and John Whitten.

A broad array of styles and approaches to creating art will be featured, in photography, painting, drawing, mixed media, printmaking and video.

Gallery hours are 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday, with extra hours during the Corvallis Arts Walk. A closing reception, open to the public, will be held from 4:30-5:30 p.m. on Sept. 28.

destinations.name: Karen Wysopal Studio
destinations.description: New works in Alcohol Ink and High Textured Acrylic Paintings

destinations.name: Living Room Gallery
destinations.description: Two lovers, united over 1300 miles in the town where they first met.  Paintings by Grace Noel and Nicholas Campbell.

destinations.name: Majestic Theatre
destinations.description: For centuries, plant-life has captured the hearts and minds of artists. Flora has been used as symbols, decorative elements, and subjects of masterpieces. During the month of July, we turn our attention to the green lives that grow all around us. We call upon local artists to help us turn our gallery into a botanical art garden.

destinations.name: Pegasus
destinations.description: Art and artists from the Window on Art project.  Ranging from exploratory to practiced and performance to photo this exhibit spans the entirety.  Artists include Christopher Adams, Tanner Henderson, Francisco Morales, Madelaine Corbin, Lauren Ohlgren, Katrina Henry and Lauren Sharpton.

destinations.name: The Rabbit Hole
destinations.description: View Rachel’s small paintings from  "When Mirrors Chase Sky" Series, packed with intense color & writing & New huge coloring pages from Laurel!

destinations.name: Studio Beatrice
destinations.description: Dale Donovan has an array of new porcelain pottery fresh out of the kiln to show us this month.  Music by Marshall Adams and Wine tasting by Spindrift Cellars.  And plenty of surprises you won't want to miss!

destinations.name: Studio262
destinations.description: Watch the NeverEnding story by Studio262 owner, Jennifer Lommers, come to a close as the final pieces of her latest series fill the gallery wall with 128 pieces of art. Painting, music, and treats to celebrate the evening. Stop in and enjoy her story and the sight of her big, magical tree!

destinations.name: Voices Gallery
destinations.description: Red is the color of Passion and the artists of Voices Gallery are excited to share their red inspirations with you.
